summary: This is an email exchange from June 11, 2019, regarding scheduling a meeting to discuss the plan for the Epstein case. Laura Birger, Chief of the Criminal Division at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY, requests a meeting with an unnamed recipient and 'Russell'.

persons.name: Laura Birger
persons.role: Chief, Criminal Division, United States Attorney's Office, SDNY
persons.context: She is the sender of an email requesting a meeting to discuss the plan for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Russell
persons.context: He is mentioned as a participant in the requested meeting about the Epstein case plan.

connections.description: They are planning to meet together with an unnamed recipient to discuss the Epstein case.

events.title: Email about Epstein case meeting
events.description: Laura Birger emails an unnamed recipient to schedule a meeting with herself and Russell to discuss the plan for the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The email is dated June 11, 2019, after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019, indicating ongoing case planning.
Laura Birger, Chief of the Criminal Division for the SDNY, is directly involved in planning for the Epstein case.
An unnamed recipient is in El Salvador and suggests meeting the following week.
The subject and content confirm the 'Epstein matter' was an active topic of discussion among SDNY prosecutors in mid-2019.
